channel.title: Pages on Tianqi
channel.description: Recent content in Pages on Tianqi

item.title: About me
item.author: tianqi93@connect.hku.hk (Tianqi)
item.description: I am currently a first-year PhD student in the Department of Speech and Hearing Science at The University of Hong Kong. I am working on the psychology of language under the supervision of Dr. Manwa Lawrence Ng and Dr. Xu Xu. In particular, I am using computational models, including machine learning and deep learning, to understand the processing of lexical and semantic representation in both comprehension and production. Prior to my study in HKU, I received graduate training in Shanghai Jiao Tong University, and worked as a research assistant in Shenzhen Institutes of Advanced Technology, Chinese Academy of Sciences.

Towards the speech features of mild cognitive impairment: Universal evidence from structured and unstructured connected speech of Chinese. Interspeech 2019 (EI) [PDF] Wang, T., Yan, Q., Pan, J., Zhu, F., Su, R., Guo, Y., Wang, L., & Yan, N. (2019). Towards the speech features of early-stage dementia: Design and application of the Mandarin elderly cognitive speech database.
